content: single_crochet in next space until you come to the edge of the bag repeat the above 5 steps for the other side of the bag 3 work further handle rounds working around as for body repeat chain 6 single_crochet in next space for 2 or 3 complete rounds finishing at the side above the starting tail to end with a complete round the bag in the photo has 13 spaces across so i worked 4 skipped 5 then worked 4 each side finish off cut the working yarn about 15cm/6 from your last stitch and pull the yarn end all the way through the loop on the hook to prevent your work from unravelling thread a darning needle with the yarn end and weave it in and out of your crochet fabric to hide and secure it at the base of your bag unpick any unused chains from the slip knot end of the tail one at a time back to a couple of chains from the edge of your work then pull firmly to secure your stitches thread a darning needle with the yarn end and weave it in as you did for at the top of the bag well done you ve finished your bag written pattern copyright susan sands 2019 this pattern is for personal use only copying distribution or commercial use of this pattern or any of its parts is not allowed
